I was in debt after

These are the stories that

up in Boise,

2279.60.text: the Utah Jazz minor league time.

because I was a new

And I only made that job

2298.77.text:
I thought I was a good

but all they say in me

and you're going

Can you pout about it

2314.93.text: Like, I said, you know what?

I'm going to learn how

2318.01.text:
I'm going to learn

2320.00.text: Your network is your net worth.

2326.00.text:
in the world, not

I learned that skill

2330.45.text:
of these business owners in

2339.38.text:
that allowed me to

I learned to utilize it and

2348.37.text:
Don't get frustrated

But within one week,

2366.45.text:
the same team in Turkey I had

2370.16.text: Yo, dawg. This is a good team.

And so, by default, I

And my first game as a starting

2390.90.text:
Lance Allred showing you a

2396.33.text:
and one thing everybody
watching the game has

2398.39.text:
>> If you're going to be

you can't be successful

2410.03.text:
that you can best position

2412.83.text:

2415.93.text:
Most of life is luck and

2418.40.text:
You guys are now starting to

2421.02.text: But from there, I just blew up.

I went to NBA All Star

2428.71.text:

But there's a saying
in pro sports,

it's kind of racist,

2442.97.text:
I was a junkyard dog

gritty-gritty rebounder,

2453.59.text:
in the D League this season

2456.65.text:

and becoming the first legally

2466.56.text:
then another contract

2471.89.text:
Reality can never live up to
our fantasies and expectations.

2477.37.text:
Ever. Hollywood's done
us this great disservice.

2481.39.text:
Oh, that Nicholas Sparks
movie, triumphant kiss,

2484.89.text:
magical musical score in
the rain, end roll credits,

2488.44.text:
and they live happily
ever after.

2493.39.text:
Life and society has taught
us that we find our self worth

2496.08.text:
in the next event horizon
and the next event horizon

2498.36.text:
and the next event horizon,
and you're only as good

2500.50.text:
as your highs and
as bad as your lows.

2505.19.text:
And I remember, I
was standing there

2506.83.text:
on an NBA court shooting

2510.25.text:
Lebron's there getting

2511.77.text: and I'm thinking is this it?

2514.13.text: Is this the best that it gets?

2519.57.text: Why don't I feel any different?

2521.76.text:
Why don't I feel like this
hole in my gut is filled?

2526.40.text:
I'm still looking for other

2528.40.text:
and make me feel

2533.77.text:
because I thought
I would be feeling

2537.04.text:
I was expecting to

and then, my second

2551.57.text:
about life learning how

and my thought patterns,

And one thing I learned, the

is confidence and humility are

2567.09.text:
If you're confident in

2569.58.text:
you have no problem asking for

2577.80.text:
Just as this is two

2582.01.text:
You have the guys that have to

2584.15.text:
for advice because
they're so insecure

2585.98.text:
that they cannot have anyone

I've had one coach

2592.55.text:
of professional basketball

and they know they

2612.78.text:
I'm going to give you

2614.34.text:

values your role and

I finally realized what

something that I had never

2671.24.text: And I was so proud of him.

2673.63.text:

2675.22.text:
I was watching him eat
Cheerios with his fingers

2676.97.text:
and I'm thinking,
I'm so proud of him.

2679.83.text:
If I can be proud

2686.07.text:
>> -- why can't I

2689.65.text:
For years, I tried

2692.76.text:
He was a loser, he was a

2700.04.text:
and I kept trying

2701.32.text:

2703.21.text:

my life and I kept thinking,

2706.55.text:
someone else, my soul mate,
somebody was going to come

2710.82.text:
That soul mate story
is so ridiculous.

2713.66.text:
You are the only one
that knows the pain

2716.57.text:
We all have PTSD,

2719.56.text:

2722.01.text: to any current or future event.

2723.86.text:
And by that definition,
we all have it.

2727.38.text:
that knows the trauma

2729.33.text: I'm the only one that knows.

And then, when I realized

2733.71.text:
If an electron can be in two

2735.90.text:
then, as I am, 33-year-old
me, a year ago, why can't I go

2739.49.text:
into that memory in the Sunday
School room, walk in that door,

2743.21.text:
sit down next to that

2745.07.text:
you know what, you're

2755.20.text: That's all he wanted to hear.

2757.98.text:
And I am the only that
can do that for him.

2760.44.text:
Guys, I brought those lenses
-- we all have lenses.

2763.44.text: We tend to see trauma and pain

2764.86.text:
through the lens of
which it happened.

2769.23.text:
The five-year-old, he's
in my life, a part of me.

2771.25.text:
This last year, my last year
professionally, he was with me.

2773.65.text:
I'm inviting him out to
play every game with me.

2775.88.text:
He was a part of my life
and for all my life,

2777.55.text:
I've been trying to
leave him behind.

2779.58.text:
That's where the hole comes
from, that's what we do.

2781.03.text:
We've all compromised ourselves
at one point or another.

2783.99.text:
We've all done it to earn love,
to be cool, to be popular,

2788.92.text:
and then you compromise
a piece of your soul,

2790.81.text:
and that's where

2792.46.text:
Guys, if you learn to
do this and be a leader

2794.94.text:
of your own life,
amazing things happen.

2797.32.text:
In the six months that I retired
from basketball, from a year ago

2799.93.text:
when I started doing this,
I have come into more wealth

2802.42.text:
and abundance than I could even

2809.60.text:
I don't need someone else's

2813.66.text:

2815.10.text: to mediate between me and God.

2816.78.text:

2819.01.text: because I am the only one

2820.52.text:
that knows everything

2823.46.text:

2825.75.text:
If you can do this, be a

2828.16.text:
your lives with change in
